text: public enum FileMode { CreateNew, Create, Open, OpenOrCreate, Truncate, Append } Table 19-5. Members of the FileMode Enumeration Member Meaning in Life CreateNew Informs the OS to make a new file. If it already exists, an I0Exception is thrown. Create Informs the OS to make a new file. If it already exists, it will be overwritten. Open Opens an existing file. If the file does not exist, a FileNotFoundException is thrown. OpenOrCreate Opens the file if it exists; otherwise, a new file is created. Truncate Opens an existing file and truncates the file to 0 bytes in size. Append Opens a file, moves to the end of the file, and begins write operations (you can use this flag only with a write-only stream). If the file does not exist, a new file is created.
